crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects malicious document used by MuddyWater
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects an office document with an embedded VBA project. While this is fairly common it is sometimes used for malicious intent.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature identifies Adobe Extensible Metadata Platform (XMP) identifiers embedded within files. Defined as a standard for mapping graphical asset relationships, XMP allows for tracking of both parent-child relationships and individual revisions. There are three categories of identifiers: original document, document, and instance. Generally, XMP data is stored in XML format, updated on save/copy, and embedded within the graphical asset. These identifiers can be used to track both malicious and benign graphics within common Microsoft and Adobe document lures.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: detects OLE documents with suspicious ActiveX content
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: ditekSHen

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation
Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe" "C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs" ; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -w 1 -exec Bypass -nologo -noprofile -c iex(get-content "C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.ini");; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes spawned by PowerShell

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "AccessVBOM" to a value of "1" which disables trust access for VBA on the victim machine and lets attackers execute malicious macros without any Microsoft Office warnings.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: File With Uncommon Extension Created By An Office Application
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of files with an executable or script extension by an Office application.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Vadim Khrykov (ThreatIntel), Cyb3rEng (Rule), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from one of the Microsoft Office suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio, etc.)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, FPT.EagleEye Team, Vadim Khrykov, Cyb3rEng, Michael Haag, Christopher Peacock @securepeacock, @scythe_io

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft \xae Windows Script Host; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=wscript.exe; Hashes=SHA1=2661E5F3562DD03C0ED21C33E2888E2FD1137D8C,MD5=9A68ADD12EB50DDE7586782C3EB9FF9C,SHA256=62A95C926C8513C9F3ACF65A5B33CBB88174555E2759C1B52DD6629F743A59ED,IMPHASH=93B1E62305A8CEC30A5FBE39C04A90BD; Description=Microsoft \xae Windows Based Script Host; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office16\WINWORD.EXE" /Automation -Embedding; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe" "C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs" ; FileVersion=5.812.10240.16384; ParentImage=C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Office16\WINWORD.EXE; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changes to Microsoft Office protected view registry keys with which the attacker disables this feature.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=ATTRIB.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=D5A1F1B5E07544C6FB03CD6A743E59A573864754,MD5=FDC601145CD289C6FBC96D3F805F3CD7,SHA256=FF8600A444A3F086F17A24293E0172E6033D62C3766D4497997B882D663F8221,IMPHASH=2CB38FE7D8F223D9DA50B7CBA9B95A6D; Description=Attribute Utility; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -w 1 -exec Bypass -nologo -noprofile -c iex(get-content "C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.ini");; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\attrib.exe" +s +h C:\ProgramData\WindowsNT\WindowsNT.vbs; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\attrib.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "VBAWarning" to a value of "1" which enables the execution of all macros, whether signed or unsigned.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.
